幾錢個月？會唔會好多人

人多

但留意番黃埔goji有班藍絲阿嬸
晚晚焗完桑拿
大大聲高談闊論佢地既無腦歪理
好似成個更衣室都係佢地世界
你頂得順就去

replies.msg: D人話同加記執笠前夕一樣
The membership agreement grants you access to the swimming pool as well as the gym

My friend Jo is a gym membership saleswoman in Go-Ji Studio who'll be sending a follow-up email and making a follow-up call this evening to a customer who's interested in joining the ten year membership. I used to work in a gym and whenever a customer paid a visit to the gym I always followed it up with a call or an email. Some of my colleagues followed it up with a visit to the customer. My friend Ken is interested in joining her gym. He had a meeting at his office yesterday and a follow-up has been scheduled for tomorrow. He's also writing a follow-up to the acclaimed "the invisible man" so he's so busy that he won't have time to pay a follow-up visit to the gym for the time being. Therefore I handed him the membership agreement for Jo and will follow up with him in the next few days. The membership costs eight hundred dollars a month which is well worth it for the broad range of facilities you can use. The agreement grants you access to the swimming pool, sauna and the steam room as well as the gym. They sell a tub of whey protein for five hundred dollars which is well worth it as its normally twice as expensive. The cost of soy protein has edged lower by five dollars whereas that of casein protein has edged up by ten dollars. The cost of creatine has edged down to three hundred dollars while that of nitric oxide has edged higher from four hundred to four hundred and eleven dollars. Last Sunday Ken complained that he was treated badly at Starbucks. As a result a barista provided a referral to a senior staff member who in turn referred his case to the manager. He'll follow up with the manager on the case to be sure that it'll be dealt with seriously. In addition he's been suffering from a stroke so I referred him to a cardiologist. Recently he posted on an online forum and suggested the government build an art gallery so as to boost tourism which was supported by many people on the forum. They asked the forum administrator for a referral to a district councilor. They'll follow up with the district councilor on the issue. I too will follow up on the matter being discussed. His suggestions for the citizens and the city's future are deemed necessary. The other day Jo and I went to a museum where i looked at every single huge nineteenth-century painting in minute detail so as not to miss any wonderful things. Jo will be giving a party next Sunday in Rosewood hotel instead of at her home so as not to bother her neighboring homeowners.
